5885.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انشَقَّتْ

clauses-arabic.clause: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انشَقَّتْ

clauses-english.clause: When the sky has split [open]

5886.verse-english: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]

clauses-english.clause: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]

5887.verse-english: And when the earth has been extended

clauses-english.clause: And when the earth has been extended

5888.verse-english: And has cast out that within it and relinquished [it]

clauses-english.clause: And has cast out that within it and relinquished [it]

5889.verse-english: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -

clauses-english.clause: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -

5890.verse-arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنسَانُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَاقِيهِ
5890.verse-english: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet it.

clauses-english.clause: O mankind,
indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet it.

5891.verse-english: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,

clauses-english.clause: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,

5892.verse-english: He will be judged with an easy account

clauses-english.clause: He will be judged with an easy account

5893.verse-english: And return to his people in happiness.

clauses-english.clause: And return to his people in happiness.

5894.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ
5894.verse-english: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,

clauses-arabic.clause: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ

clauses-english.clause: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,

5895.verse-english: He will cry out for destruction

clauses-english.clause: He will cry out for destruction

5896.verse-english: And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.

clauses-english.clause: And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.

5897.verse-english: Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
he had [once] been among his people in happiness;

5898.verse-english: Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
he had thought he would never return [to God].

5899.verse-arabic: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا
5899.verse-english: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever of him, Seeing.

clauses-english.clause: But yes!
Indeed,
his Lord was ever of him,
Seeing.

5900.verse-english: So I swear by the twilight glow

clauses-english.clause: So I swear by the twilight glow

5901.verse-english: And [by] the night and what it envelops

clauses-english.clause: And [by] the night and what it envelops

5902.verse-english: And [by] the moon when it becomes full

clauses-english.clause: And [by] the moon when it becomes full

5903.verse-english: [That] you will surely experience state after state.

clauses-english.clause: [That] you will surely experience state after state.

5904.verse-english: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

clauses-english.clause: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

5905.verse-arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْآنُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
5905.verse-english: And when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allah]?

clauses-english.clause: And when the Qur'an is recited to them,
they do not prostrate [to God]?

5906.verse-english: But those who have disbelieved deny,

clauses-english.clause: But those who have disbelieved deny,

5907.verse-english: And Allah is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.

clauses-english.clause: And God is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.

5908.verse-english: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

clauses-english.clause: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

5909.verse-arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
5909.verse-english: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.

clauses-english.clause: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds.
For them is a reward uninterrupted.
